Programming Practices - Unexpected Behavior
Avoid local variables shadowing class fields
Child class fields should not shadow parent class fields
Inherited member visibility should not be decreased
Track "FIXME" tags
Track "TODO" tags
Classes implementing "IEquatable<T>" should be sealed
Empty arrays and collections should be returned instead of null
Interface instances should not be cast to concrete types
Ensure proper arguments to Events
Avoid using Assembly.LoadFrom, Assembly.LoadFile and Assembly.LoadWithPartialName
Avoid methods named without following synchronous/asynchronous convention
Culture Dependent String operations should specify culture
Mutable static fields of type System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<T> or System.Array should not be public static
Avoid creating exception without throwing them
Use Logical OR and AND instead of Bitwise OR and AND in boolean context
Avoid empty finalizers
Avoid recursive type inheritance
For loop stop condition should be invariant
Ensure constructors of serializable classes are secure
Merge adjacent try blocks with identical catch/finally statements
Avoid assignments in sub-expressions
Avoid creating new instance of shared instance (.NET)
Recursion should not be infinite
Ensure Serializable Types Follow Best Practices
Members of larger scope element should not have conflicting transparency annotations
Avoid NULL Pointer Dereference
Avoid having the same implementation in ALL BRANCHES of a conditional structure
Avoid Persist Security Info in connection string
Avoid hidden form field
Avoid security-critical information exposure
Avoid using XmlDocument without restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE)
Avoid using XmlTextReader without restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE)
Avoid using XPathNavigator without restriction of XML External Entity Reference (XXE)
Avoid direct use of threads (.Net)
Avoid unsafe object binding (.NET)
Ensure to abandon previous session before modifying current session
Ensure cookieless attributes are set to UseCookies
Avoid ELMAH enabled in production
Avoid storing password in String
Avoid copying buffer without checking the size of input
Avoid using Thread.Sleep with dynamic parameter in a controller action
Ensure to enable column encryption in connection string
Avoid static variable modification in methods for class inheriting from System.Web.UI.Page
Ensure to set both 'Encrypt' and 'TrustServerCertificate' to true when connecting to a SQL Server
Avoid Insufficient Session Expiration in config file(.NET)
